intro: Acer pectinatum subsp. formosanum, commonly known as the Formosan maple, is a deciduous tree native to Taiwan. It is characterized by its striking, palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in autumn. The plant belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters with a spreading crown. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming more fissured with age.
